subject: Fix the UUIDs in the target's /boot/loader/entries/*
commitMessage:
Fix the UUIDs in the target's /boot/loader/entries/*

After the rsync, the installed /boot/loader/entries/* will contain the
PARTUUIDs from the raw image and thus do not correspond with the
PARTUUIDs needed for the target partitions.

The fix here is to iterate through the conf files in the
/boot/loader/entries/ directory and substitute the PARTUUID from the
output of 'blkid', with the old PARTUUID in those files.

Signed-off-by: William Douglas <william.douglas@intel.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

William,

just to make double sure I understand. pc-installer creates partitions on sda, and the partitions will have new UUIDs. Then it rsyncs, so the contents of SDA partitions will be the same as the contents of the usb stick paritions.

And then you need to fix-up the places where we refer to PARTUUIDs, right? If yes, then I agree with this patch.

But I am also interested in UUIDs - we want to use them in /etc/fstab, but we are blocked by systemd now, and BTW, the bug is assigned to you :-) Will pc-installer also fix-up the UUIDs in fstab? Or it already does?

Patch Set 1:

Hi Artem, you are correct in assessing this patch. Also the fstab change is already in (exists above this one if you want to view context).

Patch Set 1:

I wonder why you don't merge this patch?

Patch Set 1:

I'm looking for Tracy to verify on her Bayley Bay as this should be the final change for the installer to be functional for IVI.

Patch Set 1:

If you want to verify though I'd appreciate it, just want to ensure the 32bit efi works as expected.

Patch Set 1:

Quick update on this...I did get a chance to look at this. I got hung up in the config file. Need to sync up with you, William, on that to make sure I get that right. It's not working for me and it is most likely my conf file.

Patch Set 1: Verified+1

This change works okay when installing to an EFI system.

Patch Set 1:

I guess it is time to merge and release this one?
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Fix the UUIDs in the target /etc/fstab
commitMessage:
Fix the UUIDs in the target /etc/fstab

After the rsync, the installed /etc/fstab will contain the UUIDs from
the raw image and thus do not correspond with the UUIDs needed for the
target partitions.

The fix here is to iterate through the partitions after install, get the
UUIDs from the output of 'blkid', and substituting the old UUIDs with
the new ones.

Change-Id: Iee478c2fc93f5685891c0e7374f23c5e85b05610

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Remove the ACL option for rsync; fails for vfat
commitMessage:
Remove the ACL option for rsync; fails for vfat

If the "preserve-ACL" option is used when we have a separate /boot
partition with vfat filesystem (for EFI installs), then rsync will
refuse to copy over files from this partition, since ACLs are not
supported on vfat.

The copy succeeds after removing this option.

Change-Id: I64bf3a832346e8d1bb72f755062bda0a3de41e9f

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Use /etc/fstab for now
commitMessage:
Use /etc/fstab for now

Eventually we want to switch to use systemd mount units instead of the
fstab, but since the installer will not be generating mount units yet,
the fstab is still required.

Change-Id: I3bc5d2988d159b5fbd652fcc1f37bf57f7fa0ca5

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Split extlinux installation into a new function
commitMessage:
Split extlinux installation into a new function

The extlinux install should only be done for MBR, so split this logic
out into a new function.

Also, use $INSTALLERFW_KERNEL_OPTS in the extlinux.conf instead of the
hardcoded options.

Change-Id: I2669ebcd9d3327ca18a1d6d102b6ee07d274eeaa

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Remove the plymouth theme symlink
commitMessage:
Remove the plymouth theme symlink

The plymouth themes for PC will be unified in the future, so there's no
need to create a symlink here for special handling.

Change-Id: I047f77cbf2a3d60006bb6ac1faa91e224992e425

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Removing the remaining bits of swap support
commitMessage:
Removing the remaining bits of swap support

PC is not supporting swap partitions at the moment, so remove the logic
to create the unit files, etc.

Change-Id: I453ea8fa2207f5efc159c83c6855933e66104865

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Make adjustments for mounting the target partitions
commitMessage:
Make adjustments for mounting the target partitions

Use the MOUNTPOINT variables from installer.conf to mount the target
partitions, in preparation for the rsync operation.

NOTE: for now, we expect the rootfs partition to be the *last* entry in
installer.conf so that we can mount it first.

Change-Id: If34fb34855790285e32dd86890a2e38c63c8f73d

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Make adjustments for formatting the target partitions
commitMessage:
Make adjustments for formatting the target partitions

Use the FSTYPE variables from installer.conf to correctly format the
target partitions.

Change-Id: Ibc87219f241e1e9d8268a4f2768760d6f6a81ee1

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

Nevermind, see next patch =P.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Split partitioning logic to either run sfdisk or sgdisk
commitMessage:
Split partitioning logic to either run sfdisk or sgdisk

Using the input string generated in the appropriate *_options function,
now partition the device using either sfdisk or sgdisk.

Only MBR and GPT are supported, so any other partition table formats are
ignored.

Change-Id: I78ee6bb7fd6077725b30fa5f8622c4ab3c6dcdfc

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Add routines to build input strings for sfdisk/sgdisk
commitMessage:
Add routines to build input strings for sfdisk/sgdisk

To prepare for partitioning the device, build an input string for either
sfdisk (MBR support) or sgdisk (GPT support) by using the INSTALLERFW
variables from /etc/installer.conf.

Change-Id: If30fa2ea22846072f3f8e57f6b1c39365add24e5

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: packaging: require dosfstools and gptfdisk
commitMessage:
packaging: require dosfstools and gptfdisk

Adds new dependencies for the installer:

- dosfstools, to make 'mkfs.vfat' available for EFI image support
- gptfdisk, to make 'sgdisk' available for non-interactive GPT partitioning

Change-Id: Ica741c6fec799d6abb7002b4ebe32a8ad4fa8fac

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

Should make this change before using sgdisk.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Partially revert "Move the partition logic to GNU parted"
commitMessage:
Partially revert "Move the partition logic to GNU parted"

In an upcoming change, we will be building an input string to pass to
sgdisk to support GPT. To simplify the logic in the script, we also can
build an input string for sfdisk, so switch back to sfdisk for now.

This partially reverts commit b667b691fe8d8ae4dfa2558bd1060ea92823f632

Change-Id: Ica44876887c64b3a26808e77dc6d88b07a997818

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Fix indentation of conditional statements
commitMessage:
Fix indentation of conditional statements

Change-Id: I7e7aca3e3b870dd685012638d4c9ec48c57acff8

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Fix a typo in the conf generator script
commitMessage:
Fix a typo in the conf generator script

Change-Id: I535c98bcb5c0bc41eea4c2844e70659bb6d9f42b

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Make use of only shell builtins to loop over partitions
commitMessage:
Make use of only shell builtins to loop over partitions

Instead of using the external seq and expr programs, use a shell
variable for looping over partitions. In this case the
INSTALLER_FW_PART_COUNT must be checked to have been set by MIC
so do so before starting the loop.

Change-Id: I46fc4603510761bb092fe3217fc82d9dbce87f46
Signed-off-by: William Douglas <william.douglas@intel.com>

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Create or overwrite on first write to installer.conf
commitMessage:
Create or overwrite on first write to installer.conf

Ensure that there isn't anything left over in the installer.conf file
before the installer-conf-creator script runs by not using append for
the first write.

This removes implicit assumption that there is not a installer.conf
in place before the installer-conf-creator script runs making things
a little safer.

Signed-off-by: William Douglas <william.douglas@intel.com>

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Quote all variables when creating installer.conf
commitMessage:
Quote all variables when creating installer.conf

Instead of selectively quoting only variables that are expected to
contain whitespace, quote all variables as there are not downsides
for quoting with our use case as this is safer and makes the code
cleaner.

Signed-off-by: William Douglas <william.douglas@intel.com>

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Use /bin/sh since we don't need bash features
commitMessage:
Use /bin/sh since we don't need bash features

Also add options for disabling pathname expansion and exit
immediately if an untested expression fails.

Note we do not set -u as we expect to use unset variables as MIC is
not setting every INSTALLERFW_* variable correctly but this may be
changed in the future.

Signed-off-by: William Douglas <william.douglas@intel.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Thanks William for taking my comments into account.

Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+2

No problem, glad to get feedback for improvements. I don't try and do much bash work =P.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Add script to export installer variables from MIC
commitMessage:
Add script to export installer variables from MIC

This script is intended to be run in MIC %post section so that the
installer will be able to use the same settings as image creation did
to setup the target device's partition, bootloader, and filesystem
types.

Signed-off-by: William Douglas <william.douglas@intel.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+2

These changes will go in as is until MIC is able to export this information to a settings file.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)

Several notes in inline comments. You may take them into account if you want.

subject: quote vars that may contain spaces
commitMessage:
quote vars that may contain spaces

Signed-off-by: William Douglas <william.douglas@intel.com>

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

Patch Set 1:

Instead of quoting some variables, use good shell practices and simply quote everything every time. This will make the scripts less messy, more secure, and easier to read.

This patch quotes only some, so it introduces to the untidiness, in my opinion.

There are rare situations when you do not want to quote, but they are exceptions.

subject: remove ivi/pc hardcoding
commitMessage:
remove ivi/pc hardcoding

- We now rely on one single configuration file that can be set
when creating images.
- Added option -a to make it work with plymouth when called from
 systemd
- renamed pc-installer -> system-installer
- Cleanup spec

Change-Id: I043cd63675cc455f5f2b7d1c207841d403effbb7
Signed-off-by: Anas Nashif <anas.nashif@intel.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Can I assume that it is MIC's job to create the config file and install it inside /etc so that this script can read it?

Patch Set 1:

yes, configuration should be set somewhere else, hardcoding it in a package for profiles is not clean and not flexible.

Patch Set 3:

why are you combining the two commits?

Patch Set 3:

There is a commit that got in before this one. I just reformatted it since this patch makes everything look right.

Patch Set 3: Verified+1 Code-Review+2

This change requires changes the kernel commandline option for wipe and install to use the system-installer.service and for an /etc/installer.conf file to be present.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Move the partition logic to GNU parted
commitMessage:
Move the partition logic to GNU parted

Changes
* The partition now depends on parted instead of sfdisk
* The partition table is now gpt instead of msdos
* The exit $RETVAL is removed to avoid sciprt exiting after
  finding the partitions

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Make pc-installer work for IVI images which use raw image instead of squashfs
commitMessage:
Make pc-installer work for IVI images which use raw image instead of squashfs

Changes
* Check if the image if PC, then use btrfs ignoring any config file
* If it is not a PC image, try to read the installer.conf file to check the existence of
    FILESYSTEM=somefs
* If none work, then try checking what all filesystems are supported by
    installer and the kernel
* Use full /sbin/sfdisk -when installing IVI images, sfdisk cannot be found error
* Create btrfs subvolume only if the filesystem is btrfs
* For squashfs image is not present, then SRCOSMNT as /
* Exclude /media/* from rsync as during IVI, it leads to infinite recursive copy
* Exclude other temporary mount points for virtual filesystems
* Put rootflags=subvol=tizen in extlinux.conf only if it is a PC image
* IVI does not have initramfs, so copy that file only if it is a PC image
* vmlinuz* matches multiple files, so copying it to one single file won't work. Copy
  all the files and then rename vmlinuz to vmlinuz0
* Replace extlinux with /sbin/extlinux
* sync the filesystem before unmount and not after
* Use echo when plymouth isn't available

Signed-off-by: Manish Sinha <manish.sinha@intel.com>
Change-Id: I605e35b1a101d92735e6b5465b24291f382f11a8

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

rpmlint checked packaging/pc-installer.spec: 3 errors, 1 warnings.
- W: non-standard-group Base/System
- line 24: E: hardcoded-library-path in %{buildroot}/usr/lib/systemd/system
- line 26: E: hardcoded-library-path in %{buildroot}/usr/lib/systemd/system
- line 33: E: hardcoded-library-path in /usr/lib/systemd/system/pc-installer.service

Patch Set 1:

The tag submit/tizen/20130624.204948 pushed, but the commit 605e35b1a101d92735e6b5465b24291f382f11a8 is still under review in gerrit. After reviewer accpet this commit, it will be submitted to OBS corresponding project.

Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       armv7hl        failed         

 standard       x86_64         failed         

 standard       i586           failed

Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

the installer should have NO knowledge if that is PC or IVI or whatever. The installer needs to install based on the image type (liveusb image does not mean it is a PC image) and based on the target requirements,so it is about features and capabilities and not about PC or IVI because those are completely interchangeable and I should be able to install btrfs on IVI just like I might consider ext4 on PC.

So, the runtime check for the profile IMO should not be part of the installer and how you install should only be based on features.

Patch Set 1:

Hello Anas,

I talked to William and he asked to check for PC or IVI because they need PC images to be *btrfs*, so that is why whenever a PC image is found - it is forced to be btrfs

The check for squashfs is not assumed to for PC or IVI. As per this change, the installer checks if squashfs image exists (regardless of PC/IVI), it will try to install from there else fall back to installing from /

You can install btrfs on IVI *if* the installer and kernel support it. That is where features and capabilities are checked. If IVI kernel has btrfs support, it will go with btrfs else fall back to ext4

The config file contains the filesystem type, so if you want to use ext3 on IVI, it will work. Except - PC where William asked it to be strict btrfs

- line 44: E: hardcoded-library-path in %{buildroot}/usr/lib/systemd/system
- line 46: E: hardcoded-library-path in %{buildroot}/usr/lib/systemd/system
- line 53: E: hardcoded-library-path in /usr/lib/systemd/system/pc-installer.service

(1 inline comment)

Would prefer not to see hardcoded paths in spec where macros could be used. Also should fix license name in spec. Minor things.

I see that there have been other changes to pc-installer that went into OBS, so there will be a merge conflict if these changes are all accepted. It will prevent the SR submission until conflicts are resolved. Snags alot of folks wondering where their SR went. Just a heads up.

Patch Set 2:

Thanks Tracy, I am aware of the other changes to pc-installer that this change will need to rebase on. We just wanted to put this up for review early. It isn't verified yet either we just wanted to get comments on the acceptability of this change.

subject: Use the swap partition.
commitMessage:
Use the swap partition.

While we were creating a partition to be used for swap, it was not
actually getting formatted or mounted.

Also since we are using swap for hibernate make sure to add resume
from the swap partition to the syslinux config file.

Signed-off-by: William Douglas <william.douglas@intel.com>
